intro: Fagara mauiensis var. cranwelliae, commonly known as the Maui fagara, is a rare plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive, fragrant leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical rainforests. It produces small, white flowers that are followed by spherical, blue-black berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
